image.altText: a groupd of about sixty people from the National Socialist Network dressed in black at a rally outside parliament house sydney

props.synopsis: In a statement posted to Telegram, the group announced the closure of the National Socialist Network would also spell the end of "co-projects" White Australia, the European Australian Movement and the White Australia Party.

title.children: Neo-Nazi group says it will disband due to proposed hate speech laws

image.altText: A temporary fence with the words ADELAIDE WRITERS on it

props.synopsis: The remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down and this year's Writers' Week event has been cancelled, after days of furore regarding the decision to cancel a scheduled appearance by Palestinian Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah.

title.children: Adelaide Writers' Week cancelled after week of escalating controversy

image.altText: A portrait of Craig Silvey, 43, with short brown hair and stubble, smiling brightly with his hands in his pockets.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most renowned authors, Craig Silvey, faces court after he allegedly distributed child exploitation material.

title.children: Author Craig Silvey not cooperating with authorities after arrest, court told

image.altText: kevin rudd stands under a circular light that looks like a halo

props.synopsis: One month after Kevin Rudd leaves his post as Australia's ambassador to Washington, Donald Trump will make his first presidential visit to China in almost 10 years.

title.children: The sort of world in which Rudd has lived most of his career is now gone

image.altText: Smoke billows across a street at night as people protest.

props.synopsis: Human rights groups estimate more than 500 people have been killed and more than 10,600 arrested in the ongoing protests.

title.children: Iran using 'military-grade' jamming to take down Musk's Starlink

image.altText: A jeep and a crew member in a fire region

props.synopsis: Communities around Victoria continue to count the cost of devastating bushfires, with more than 500 structures — including almost 179 homes — lost or damaged so far.

title.children: 500 structures lost in Vic bushfires with a dozen fires still burning

image.altText: helicopter hovering above flooded town

props.synopsis: A clean-up is under way at Clermont, which remains cut off by floodwaters, as already-saturated western communities are being warned of possible heavy rains.

title.children: Three people rescued from central Queensland flood as ex-Cyclone Koji moves west

image.altText: A close-up of Mark Kelly looking determined while speaking.

props.synopsis: The US Democratic senator alleges the president and defense secretary are trying to intimidate him into silence for comments he made in a video calling on serving troops to defy illegal orders.

title.children: Retired navy captain Mark Kelly sues the Pentagon over free speech

image.altText: Benches equipped with monitors and microphones sit in a courtroom, with a large screen mounted on a wall.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne courtroom descended into chaos as the 23-year-old man accused of assaulting Ismet Purdic and his wife attempted to climb out of the dock moments after being denied bail.

title.children: Chaos in court as man accused of assaulting Muslim leader is denied bail

image.altText: A man and woman, AI generated, in a store with the words 'Isla & James Bondi Beach'

props.synopsis: An online fashion retailer accused of "unconscionable conduct" has been investigated for profiting off the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Online retailer accused of trying to profit from Bondi massacre

image.altText: USA women's rugby player Ilona Maher is wearing a black cutout dress and flexes her muscles, smiling, while holding a trophy

props.synopsis: Throughout her career, former ice dancer Matilda Friend struggled with disordered eating and felt pressure to look a certain way. ABC's Women's Sport survey shows she isn't the only one.

title.children: 'How can I make my body look like that?' Inside the pressures facing elite female athletes

image.altText: A woman wearing black and sunglasses stands in a green park holding a brown dog.

props.synopsis: Some members of the Iranian diaspora in Australia are wary of foreign intervention in Iran, but others say there may not be another choice.

title.children: Does Iran need foreign intervention? What Iranian Australians say

image.altText: Anthony Albanese points at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Directly quoting from a religious text for the purpose of teaching or discussion may provide a defence under the federal government's hate speech laws proposed in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

title.children: Details of sweeping changes to hate speech and gun laws revealed

image.altText: peter malinauskas in a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Malinauskas becomes tearful during a media conference where he faces extensive questions about the crisis surrounding Adelaide Writers' Week and allegations of homophobia against Adelaide United made by former player Josh Cavallo.

title.children: 'I do my best to settle my conscience': SA premier becomes emotional at press conference

image.altText: Eagle Rock and Curracurrong Falls in the Royal national park, New South Wales.

props.synopsis: A magistrate told a 48-year-old bus driver prison is his "only possible sentence" after lighting two small fires near Sydney in December.

title.children: 'Camper' who deliberately-lit Royal National Park fires likely to be jailed

image.altText: Venus Williams plays a backhand return at the Hobart International.

props.synopsis: After being awarded a wildcard at the age of 45, seven-time major singles champion Venus Williams falls in the opening round in Hobart.

title.children: Tennis great Williams departs Hobart International in first round

image.altText: Vanevssa Mbeve sits on a chair with her clothes hanging in a walk-in robe

props.synopsis: I was tired of trying to live up to an idealised version of myself. So, I decided to do something I had learnt from Marie Kondo: sort my wardrobe into what brought me joy and what didn't.

title.children: Vanessa decluttered and said goodbye to the fantasy version of herself

image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair, standing outside the courthouse.

props.synopsis: The woman who assaulted a former Northern Territory chief minister with a cream crepe is sentenced to 12 months imprisonment, fully suspended.

title.children: Woman behind crepe attack on chief minister sentenced in court

image.altText: A handgun lying on a light-coloured sheet.

props.synopsis: A "young boy" from regional New South Wales is accused of making fake emergency calls claiming mass shootings were taking place at major retail and education institutions in the United States.

title.children: 'Widespread alarm and turmoil': NSW boy facing jail over hoax calls to US

image.altText: Police officers on patrol after the alleged firearms incident in Pinjarra.

props.synopsis: Significant police resources are deployed to Pinjarra, about 80 kilometres from Perth, after a man is reportedly spotted on CCTV with a firearm in a semi-rural area.

title.children: Police searching for man with firearm in town south of Perth

image.altText: A man wearing a wide-brimmed hat and sunglasses stands next to a woman wearing sunglasses at a marina.

props.synopsis: British Australian retiree Ian Fletcher is meant to be going on a seven-week holiday to the UK with his wife, Vicki, in April, but it may not go ahead due to passport changes.

title.children: New passport changes create headache for Australian British dual citizens

image.altText: tennis player cruz hewitt plays a backhand shot

props.synopsis: It is the second year in a row Hewitt has been knocked out in the first round of qualifying, but the match against a much higher-ranked opponent can only do good things for him.

title.children: Cruz Hewitt knocked out of Australian Open qualifying in first round

image.altText: Donald Trump wearing a dark suit and white shirt while speaking into a microphone at the White House.

props.synopsis: In the past week, the US has dramatically expanded and accelerated its attacks both inside and outside its borders. Here's where Australia stands in the fray.

title.children: Markets shudder as White House goes to war with everyone

image.altText: Two men in suits and one well dressed lady pose in front of Chinese-language banners.

props.synopsis: A husband and wife are banned from managing corporations for five years after the failure of several companies, one of which was linked to the former Wagga Wagga MP.

title.children: ASIC ban for couple linked to disgraced former MP Daryl Maguire

image.altText: man under burnt bridge with burnt batteries

props.synopsis: A bridge used daily by thousands of drivers is shut in northern NSW, after a fire beneath it destroys the camps of two homeless men with "nowhere else to go".

title.children: Byron bridge fire highlights tourist hotspot's homelessness crisis

image.altText: A motion-sensor camera image of a koala.

props.synopsis: A motion-sensor camera has captured the rare sight of a koala in the wild at a wildlife sanctuary in Googong near the ACT border.

title.children: Camera footage 'giving us hope that koalas might still be around'

image.altText: A young Japanese boy holds food to his mouth while sitting a table with other kids.

props.synopsis: While Australia grapples with childcare scandals, Japan is delivering top-quality care with professional chefs serving up nutritious food. So how did they do it?

title.children: From 'baby hotels' to restaurant-quality food: Lessons from Japan's childcare system

image.altText: A primary-school aged girl holds a mango the size of her head in front of her face.

props.synopsis: A WA mango grower is pleasantly surprised to find a crop full of massive mangoes, as big as a bowling ball.

title.children: WA mango grower finds fruit as big as bowling ball

image.altText: Two officers in head-to-toe camouflage stand between a black car and its opened door before getting in

props.synopsis: Minnesota and its two cities sue the Trump administration in a bid to stop an immigration crackdown that led to the fatal shooting of Renee Good last week.

title.children: Minnesota sues federal government to stop immigration crackdown

image.altText: Jerome Powell standing at a lectern with Donald Trump behind him.

props.synopsis: A criminal probe into the US Federal Reserve chair threatens to undermine the US dollar and the global monetary system. Local analysts warn the implications for Australia are profound.

title.children: Trump's attack on Federal Reserve 'extremely chilling'

image.altText: A man standing on a beach trying to pitch a collapsed tent.

props.synopsis: Homeless Gazans are begging the Israeli government to allow proper shelters into the strip as winter storms batter the enclave and destroy many people's tents.

title.children: Gazans beg for shelter as winter storms batter millions and Israel limits aid

image.altText: A group of children playing ice hockey on a frozen lake with houses in the background.

props.synopsis: NATO allies are now scrambling to discuss beefing up Arctic security in the hope it deflects Donald Trump away from his intensifying rhetoric towards the island territory.

title.children: Greenland government rejects American takeover 'under any circumstance'

image.altText: Bondi Beach floral tribute

props.synopsis: There will be a national day of mourning for the victims of the Bondi terror attack this month, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says.

title.children: Albanese calls national day of mourning for Bondi victims
